@jake_albaugh Saving in the browser to "single file" essentially does this, as the MHTML format was designed for this. It's well maintained, too.  Here's some additional optimizations Chrome does: https://t.co/QrGg3MRJ3k https://t.co/vnFuomo8uu
@ryanflorence @RealWebPageTest the WPT throttling is high-quality packet-level throttling. devtools throttling is at the request level, which introduces inaccuracy.  https://t.co/rhtAcNLnqv

@johnloveskylie @astrondrew @secretcinema I get the feeling their support-side is pretty overwhelmed and dejected. But also yeah, that's like 2 major messups for my booking, sounds like more for y'all. :/  Be patient and good luck y'all.

@johnloveskylie @astrondrew @secretcinema I emailed support a few hours before our showtime to ask for ticket codes. They basically said we weren't successfully rebooked from the reschedule so i had to pick a new time. Luckily there was one 30min later.  Asked for that, got ticket codes in email. Ever write a long-ass Google Docs comment and then accidentally hit Cancel?ü§¶ Not all is lost. DevTools heap snapshots to the rescue!

DevTools > Memory panel > Take snapshot. Expand the (string) item and peruse down the list. With luck, you'll find it. https://t.co/N8eqwL6qfG

@StevenKLambert But.. I don't spot anything in the positioning/backgrounds specs that touch on this sort of behavior. That said, I'm sure it's defined in a spec somewhere.

@StevenKLambert I don't know for sure, but noting that adding `position:relative` will make it look how you expect. I _think_ this has to do with the "formatting context"; I'm guessing the two boxes share one now, leading their bg's to both sit underneath their fg text.  ‚Ä¶
